intro: Phacelia scopulina var. submutica, commonly known as the roughleaf phacelia, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the Boraginaceae family and is characterized by its hairy, glandular leaves and blue to purple flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or gravelly soils and is often found in arid or semi-arid environments. It has a low, mat-forming growth habit and is adapted to withstand drought conditions. The species is valued for its ornamental appeal and its role in supporting local pollinator populations.
